aam: A Dutch and German measure of liquids varying in different cities being at Amsterdam about 41 wine gallons at Antwerp 36 at Hamburg 38 Written also Aum and Awm
aard-vark: An edentate mammal of the genus Orycteropus somewhat resembling a pig common in some parts of Southern Africa It burrows in the ground and feeds entirely on ants which it catches with its long slimy tongue
aard-wolf: A carnivorous quadruped Proteles Lalandii of South Africa resembling the fox and hyena See Proteles
aaronic: Pertaining to Aaron the first high priest of the Jews AARON S ROD Aar on s rod Etym See Exodus vii 9 and Numbers xvii 8
Arch A rod with one serpent twined around it thus differing from the caduceus of Mercury which has two
Bot A plant with a tall flowering stem esp the great mullein or hag taper and the golden rod
aaronical: Pertaining to Aaron the first high priest of the Jews AARON S ROD Aar on s rod Etym See Exodus vii 9 and Numbers xvii 8
Arch A rod with one serpent twined around it thus differing from the caduceus of Mercury which has two
Bot A plant with a tall flowering stem esp the great mullein or hag taper and the golden rod
